rationale: The agent correctly identifies the constant to modify (PAGE_MEM_OVERHEAD_PER_BLOCK) and increases the memory overhead estimate as requested. However, there are two key differences from ground truth: (1) The multiplier is 3 instead of 4, which may be insufficient for the circuit breaking scenario described in the task, resulting in a correctness penalty. (2) The agent significantly rewrote the comment documentation when the task did not request documentation changes - ground truth adds a brief addendum while agent replaces entire sentences, constituting unsolicited documentation. The core functionality change is complete (increasing the overhead), code reuse is equivalent (both multiply the constant), and both follow similar style patterns for constant multiplication.
ground_truth_patch:
diff --git a/x-pack/plugin/esql/compute/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/compute/data/Block.java b/x-pack/plugin/esql/compute/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/compute/data/Block.java
index b57b436964a..8af78dc4fa8 100644
--- a/x-pack/plugin/esql/compute/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/compute/data/Block.java
+++ b/x-pack/plugin/esql/compute/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/compute/data/Block.java
@@ -54,9 +54,10 @@ public interface Block extends Accountable, BlockLoader.Block, Writeable, RefCou
      *
      * The exact overhead per block would be (more correctly) {@link RamUsageEstimator#NUM_BYTES_OBJECT_REF},
      * but we approximate it with {@link RamUsageEstimator#NUM_BYTES_OBJECT_ALIGNMENT} to avoid further alignments
-     * to object size (at the end of the alignment, it would make no practical difference).
+     * to object size (at the end of the alignment, it would make no practical difference). We uplift it {@code * 4}
+     * based on experiments with many small pages.
      */
-    int PAGE_MEM_OVERHEAD_PER_BLOCK = RamUsageEstimator.NUM_BYTES_OBJECT_ALIGNMENT;
+    int PAGE_MEM_OVERHEAD_PER_BLOCK = RamUsageEstimator.NUM_BYTES_OBJECT_ALIGNMENT * 4;
 
     /**
      * {@return an efficient dense single-value view of this block}.
